credentials: PHD 1975 Univ of IL at Urbana-Champaign
name: RANDALL DUNHAM

ratings.comment: RANDY ROCKS. This field study/seminar was life changing. Randy is so knowledgeable and enthusiastic about life and travel and international relations. I'm so sad he's retiring and others won't get the chance. You'll put in the time and the effort, but you'll definitely be rewarded. THANK YOU RANDY!

RANDY IS THE BEST. He's so enthusiastic, has incredible working experience, and truly cares about your learning. His tests are very straightforward if you've paid attention in lecture. The practice exams help a lot. Overall, this class is very manageable and as long as you put in effort, you'll do very well. Don't purchase the book - all slides.

Randy is the best! He doesn't put much emphasis on your grades, he cares more about getting you involved in real-life scenarios and problem solving. You can learn so much from him if you come to class, and the tests are very simple!

Randy is probably my favorite professor I have had at UW - Madison.  He is super energetic, friendly, and knowledgeable about his topics.  You definitely need to attend lectures as his test questions are pretty much only related to his slides and he talks about them in great depth.  If you ever have ANY questions, he is  more than happy to help!

This class was in many ways wasted potential. The subject matter was boring and repetitive when it didn't have to be. Randy is an upbeat, enthusiastic guy who really cares about the class and his students. Unfortunately, the temporary substitute was a bit of a tyrant, but that was not the profs fault. All in all, easy class, but not fun easy.

A good professor, but really long-winded and reads a lot straight off of slides (this is for MHR300-online). The class itself is the business school's attempt to teach a class that should probably be redesigned and updated as some sort of psychology in the workplace class, not a business course.

Terrible. You spend the entire semester thinking the class is easy and then get annihilated by the midterm and final. Don't even get me started on the leadership simulation. This class is a giant waste of time and will not help your GPA.

I love Randy Dunham!! Not only was this class particularly easy, but he gives great lectures that help you understand the material.  Class exercises and case studies are interesting and not difficult.  He is a really nice guy. Missing class is okay but makes studying for quizzes more difficult.  Take this class!!

Dunham is now teaching MHR/IB 403, International Management. He is a great professor with lots of real world experience. The class is engaging (much more so than MHR 300), and very straightforward. Exams are easy, based off of powerpoint slides. Book is not necessary. Case studies are fun, plus group project is easy. Highly recommended.

Very well-spoken and knowledgable. He makes it easy for you to understand the material. The website is a little hard to navigate around, and the exams are graded very harshly. WAY too much reading.  The final is impossible to finish, but the curve makes it bearable. I didn't answer 3 of the 5 essay questions and still got an A.  Easy group project.

Most pointless class I have taken at the UW.  Almost like going back to high school.  My favorite is when Dunham extols the importance of such things "trunk strength" and "finger dexterity" in the personal characteristics lecture.  Have fun with this one.

worst class that is required for graduation, prof. dunham seems to be one of those prof's who thinks that his class is the only class we have based on the reading workload and esp. the absolutely ridiculous final.  I must give him credit for being very knowledgable regarding his field
good class/instructor but the final is killer
Great teacher with an unsurpassed command of subject matter. Significant amount of reading. Regular attendance is the most critical factor to getting a good grade. Fun guy
He is an awesome lecturer, and cute as well.
